Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RL-30 (Gj-CATH2 N-terminal fragment, RA-48 fragment, Lys-rich, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, reptiles, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (62.5%) toGj-CATH2K: 43%, I: 17%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC6538 (MIC 9.37 ug/ml) and A. baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 18.75 ug/ml).SAR: this N-terminal fragment has similar activity to WT cathelicidin, while the rest C-terminal sequence is inactive against these two bacteria.
Literature Information.Author: Wu Z, Cai Y, Han Y, Su Y, Zhang T, Wang X, Yan A, Wang L, Wu S, Wang G, Zhang Z. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Development of alpha-Helical Antimicrobial Peptides with Imperfect Amphipathicity for Superior Activity and Selectivity.
